meanings.definition: The act or process of warping or becoming warped.
meanings.sent1: The warpage of the wood caused it to bend out of shape.
meanings.sent2: The warpage of the metal sheet made it difficult to fit into place.
meanings.sent3: The warpage of the book cover made it look like a wavy potato chip.
meanings.sent4: The warpage of reality in the movie created a mind-bending experience for the audience.
meanings.sent5: The warpage of the mirror made my reflection appear distorted and elongated.

meanings.definition: The state of being warped or distorted.
meanings.sent1: The old painting showed signs of warpage from years of exposure to humidity.
meanings.sent2: The warpage of the photograph made the faces look stretched and unnatural.
meanings.sent3: The warpage of the road sign made it seem like it was dancing in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The warpage of the truth in the story added an unexpected twist to the plot.
meanings.sent5: The warpage of the fabric gave the dress a unique and uneven appearance.
